articles.title: Reeves boosts NHS and housing as some budgets squeezed
articles.description: Some departments, including the Home Office and Foreign Office, have lost out in the government's Spending Review.

articles.title: Chris Mason: This Spending Review is a gamble on patience in an era of impatience
articles.description: The big bet for the government remains on economic growth - finding it and sustaining it.

articles.title: Leisure centre attacked in third night of violence in Northern Ireland
articles.description: This comes after two days of disorder, in which 32 officers were injured and six people arrested.

articles.title: Brian Wilson, co-​creator of iconic 1960s band The Beach Boys, dies aged 82
articles.description: His songs including Surfin' USA, California Girls and God Only Knows have become pop music classics.

articles.title: New species of dinosaur discovered that 'rewrites' T.rex family tree
articles.description: The dinosaur skeletons, found hidden in a museum collection in Mongolia, is an ancestor of the mighty tyrannosaurs.

articles.title: US to partially evacuate embassy in Iraq over security threats
articles.description: Talks between the US and Iran appear to have reached an impasse, increasing  tensions in the Middle East.

articles.title: 'I made the sign of victory for Siwar': Mother's relief as malnourished Gaza baby evacuated to Jordan
articles.description: The BBC travels in an ambulance from the Gaza border to Amman with Siwar and her family

articles.title: Harvey Weinstein guilty of sexual assault after New York retrial
articles.description: The jury found him not guilty of an additional sexual assault charge, and have yet to return a verdict on a charge of rape.

articles.title: Jesus polished luxury vehicles at an LA car wash for a decade. Then ICE showed up
articles.description: The BBC obtained CCTV footage of a raid at a Los Angeles car wash that shows  how President Trump's immigration crackdown has ramped up.

articles.title: UK agrees post-Brexit deal over Gibraltar
articles.description: Talks on rules governing the border of Spain and Gibraltar have been ongoing since Britain left the EU.

articles.title: Senate Republicans Want to Trim Some of Trump’s Tax Cuts in Domestic Policy Bill
articles.description: G.O.P. senators are considering whether to further curb the president’s favorite tax cuts as they rewrite key portions of the sprawling domestic agenda bill passed by the House.

articles.title: No, Not That Lee. Pentagon Finds Black Hero to Rechristen Base Long Named for Robert E.
articles.description: The Army unveiled a list of seven installations that the Trump administration is reverting, sort of, to earlier names venerating Confederate heroes.

articles.title: McConnell Tells Hegseth U.S. Reputation Is at Stake in Ukraine War
articles.description: A testy exchange between a senator who strongly supports Ukraine aid and the defense secretary revealed a deepening split among G.O.P. officials on the war.

articles.title: U.S. to Evacuate Diplomats From Iraq Amid Iran Tensions
articles.description: The State Department said it had decided to shrink the U.S. “footprint” in Baghdad, and Britain issued a warning about “increased tensions within the region.”

articles.title: Trump Bends Military’s Role, Suggesting More Troops in More Cities
articles.description: President Trump has expanded domestic use of the armed forces, testing the limits on involving troops at protests and the border.

articles.title: Why California Says Trump’s Military Deployment Is Illegal
articles.description: California has sued the Trump administration over its move to deploy troops to Los Angeles. Eric Schmitt, a national security correspondent for The New York Times, explains the laws governing the use of American troops on U.S. soil.

articles.title: Which U.S. Cities Have Joined L.A. in Protesting Immigration Raids?
articles.description: Demonstrations are not only in Los Angeles. They have cropped up in cities across the country.

articles.title: Judge Opens Door to Releasing Mahmoud Khalil as Soon as This Week
articles.description: Mr. Khalil, a legal permanent resident, has been held in Louisiana for more than three months. The judge suggested he could be released as early as Friday unless the government successfully appeals.

articles.title: Brian Wilson, Songwriter and Leader of the Beach Boys, Dies at 82
articles.description: A hitmaker elevated and burdened by the label of genius, he transcended the breezy surf genre to create complex harmonies and intricate soundscapes in the studio.

articles.title: Beach Boy Brian Wilson’s 12 Essential Songs
articles.description: The Beach Boys leader, whose death was announced on Wednesday, was a brilliant writer, arranger and producer whose ambitions propelled his band — and contemporaries like the Beatles — into the future.
